comment: This is generated by ESQL's AbstractFunctionTestCase. Do no edit it. See ../README.md for how to regenerate it.
name: case
description:
Accepts pairs of conditions and values. The function returns the value that
belongs to the first condition that evaluates to `true`.

If the number of arguments is odd, the last argument is the default value which
is returned when no condition matches. If the number of arguments is even, and
no condition matches, the function returns `null`.

params.name: condition
params.description: A condition.

params.name: trueValue
params.description: The value that's returned when the corresponding condition is the first to evaluate to `true`. The default value is returned when no condition matches.

params.name: condition
params.description: A condition.

params.name: trueValue
params.description: The value that's returned when the corresponding condition is the first to evaluate to `true`. The default value is returned when no condition matches.

params.name: elseValue
params.description: The value that's returned when no condition evaluates to `true`.

examples:
FROM employees
| EVAL type = CASE(
    languages <= 1, "monolingual",
    languages <= 2, "bilingual",
     "polyglot")
| KEEP emp_no, languages, type

FROM sample_data
| EVAL successful = CASE(
    STARTS_WITH(message, "Connected to"), 1,
    message == "Connection error", 0
  )
| STATS success_rate = AVG(successful)

FROM sample_data
| EVAL error = CASE(message LIKE "*error*", 1, 0)
| EVAL hour = DATE_TRUNC(1 hour, @timestamp)
| STATS error_rate = AVG(error) by hour
| SORT hour
